name: PostJobBash
description: PostJobBash is a Bash@3 based task that allows you to executes bash scripts (across platforms) in the post-job phase of the job!
author: Tsvetiliyan Yankov

inputs.name: targetType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target script type: File Path or Inline

inputs.name: filePath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Must be a fully qualified path or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the shell script. Either ordinal parameters or named parameters.

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# Write your commands here

echo 'Hello world'

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

inputs.name: bashEnvValue
inputs.label: Set value for BASH_ENV environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: If input is specified, it's value is expanded and used as the path of a startup file to execute before running the script. If the environment variable `BASH_ENV` has already been defined, the task will override this variable only for the current task. You can find more details by [link](https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Bash-Startup-Files.html).

messages.JS_ExitCode_137: Bash exited with code 137, which means it ran out of memory. Make sure the agent (container) host has sufficient memory configured.
messages.JS_Stderr: Bash wrote one or more lines to the standard error stream.
messages.JS_TranslatePathFailed: Unable to translate the path '%s' to the Linux file system.
messages.JS_BashEnvAlreadyDefined: The BASH_ENV environment variable has already been set to a '%s', the task will override it with '%s'
messages.ScriptArgsSanitized: Detected characters in arguments that may not be executed correctly by the shell. Please escape special characters using backslash (\). More information is available here: https://aka.ms/ado/75787
